verses.kjv: Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest, who was also chief governor in the house of the LORD, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.
verses.web: Now Pashhur, the son of Immer the priest, who was chief officer in LORD’s house, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
verses.ct: Now Pashur son of Immer, a priest who served as the chief officer in the LORD's temple, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.

verses.kjv: Then Pashur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Then Pashhur struck Jeremiah the prophet and put him in the stocks that were in the upper gate of Benjamin, which was in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Pashur had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and locked in the stocks at the upper Benjamin Gate, which was part of the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him, The LORD hath not called thy name Pashur, but Magormissabib.
verses.web: On the next day, Pashhur released Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then Jeremiah said to him, “LORD has not called your name Pashhur, but Magormissabib.
verses.ct: The next day, Pashur released Jeremiah from the stocks. Jeremiah said to him, "The LORD hasn't named you Pashur — he's named you Magor-missabib."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends: and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it: and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive into Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.
verses.web: For LORD says, ‘Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes will see it. I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will carry them captive to Babylon, and will kill them with the sword.
verses.ct: "Because this is what the LORD says: 'I'm going to make you a source of terror — to yourself and to everyone you know. Your friends will fall by the swords of their enemies, and you'll watch it happen with your own eyes. I will hand all of Judah over to the king of Babylon, and he will drag them off as captives to Babylon and slaughter them with the sword.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will deliver all the strength of this city, and all the labours thereof, and all the precious things thereof, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies, which shall spoil them, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.
verses.web: Moreover I will give all the riches of this city, and all its gains, and all its precious things, yes, I will give all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hand of their enemies. They will make them captives, take them, and carry them to Babylon.
verses.ct: I will also hand over all the wealth of this city — everything it has produced, every precious thing, every treasure of Judah's kings — to their enemies. They will seize it all, carry it off, and take it to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And thou, Pashur, and all that dwell in thine house shall go into captivity: and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and shalt be buried there, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied lies.
verses.web: You, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house will go into captivity. You will come to Babylon, and there you will die, and there you will be buried, you, and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied falsely.’ ”
verses.ct: As for you, Pashur, you and everyone in your household will be taken captive. You will go to Babylon, and that's where you'll die and be buried — you and all the friends you fed lies to.'"

verses.kjv: O LORD, thou hast deceived me, and I was deceived: thou art stronger than I, and hast prevailed: I am in derision daily, every one mocketh me.
verses.web: LORD, you have persuaded me, and I was persuaded. You are stronger than I, and have prevailed. I have become a laughingstock all day. Everyone mocks me.
verses.ct: LORD, you persuaded me, and I let myself be persuaded. You are stronger than I am, and you won. Now I'm a joke — everyone laughs at me all day long.

verses.kjv: For since I spake, I cried out, I cried violence and spoil; because the word of the LORD was made a reproach unto me, and a derision, daily.
verses.web: For as often as I speak, I cry out; I cry, “Violence and destruction!” because LORD’s word has been made a reproach to me, and a derision, all day.
verses.ct: Every time I open my mouth, I end up shouting about violence and destruction! The word of the LORD has brought me nothing but ridicule and mockery, day after day.

verses.kjv: Then I said, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name. But his word was in mine heart as a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with forbearing, and I could not stay.
verses.web: If I say, I will not make mention of him, or speak any more in his name, then there is in my heart as it were a burning fire shut up in my bones. I am weary with holding it in. I can’t.
verses.ct: So I told myself, "I won't mention him anymore. I won't speak in his name again." But his word burned inside me like a fire locked in my bones. I was exhausted from holding it in — I just couldn't do it.

verses.kjv: For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side. Report, say they, and we will report it. All my familiars watched for my halting, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our revenge on him.
verses.web: For I have heard the defaming of many, “Terror on every side! Denounce, and we will denounce him!” say all my familiar friends, those who watch for my fall. “Perhaps he will be persuaded, and we will prevail against him, and we will take our revenge on him.”
verses.ct: I've heard the whispers of many people: "Terror on every side! Report him! Let's report him!" Even my closest friends are watching for me to stumble. "Maybe he'll slip up," they say, "and then we'll overpower him and get our revenge."

verses.kjv: But the LORD is with me as a mighty terrible one: therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall not prevail: they shall be greatly ashamed; for they shall not prosper: their everlasting confusion shall never be forgotten.
verses.web: But LORD is with me as an awesome mighty one. Therefore my persecutors will stumble, and they won’t prevail. They will be utterly disappointed, because they have not dealt wisely, even with an everlasting dishonor which will never be forgotten.
verses.ct: But the LORD stands with me like a fearsome warrior. So my persecutors will stumble and fail. They'll be completely put to shame because they didn't act wisely, and their disgrace will never be forgotten.

verses.kjv: But, O LORD of hosts, that triest the righteous, and seest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I opened my cause.
verses.web: But LORD of Armies, who tests the righteous, who sees the heart and the mind, let me see your vengeance on them, for I have revealed my cause to you.
verses.ct: LORD of hosts, you test the righteous and see into the deepest thoughts and motives of the heart. Let me see you take vengeance on them, because I've laid my case before you.

verses.kjv: Sing unto the LORD, praise ye the LORD: for he hath delivered the soul of the poor from the hand of evildoers.
verses.web: Sing to LORD! Praise LORD, for he has delivered the soul of the needy from the hand of evildoers.
verses.ct: Sing to the LORD! Praise the LORD! He has rescued the soul of the needy from the grip of evildoers.

verses.kjv: Cursed be the day wherein I was born: let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.
verses.web: Cursed is the day in which I was born. Don’t let the day in which my mother bore me be blessed.
verses.ct: Cursed be the day I was born! Let the day my mother gave birth to me never be called blessed.

verses.kjv: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man child is born unto thee; making him very glad.
verses.web: Cursed is the man who brought news to my father, saying, “A boy is born to you,” making him very glad.
verses.ct: Cursed be the man who brought the news to my father, saying, "It's a boy!" — and filled him with joy.

verses.kjv: And let that man be as the cities which the LORD overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear the cry in the morning, and the shouting at noontide;
verses.web: Let that man be as the cities which LORD overthrew, and didn’t repent. Let him hear a cry in the morning, and shouting at noontime;
verses.ct: Let that man end up like the cities the LORD overthrew without mercy. Let him hear cries of alarm in the morning and shouts of battle at noon,

verses.kjv: Because he slew me not from the womb; or that my mother might have been my grave, and her womb to be always great with me.
verses.web: because he didn’t kill me from the womb. So my mother would have been my grave, and her womb always great.
verses.ct: because he didn't kill me in the womb. Then my mother's body would have been my grave, and she would have carried me forever.

verses.kjv: Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?
verses.web: Why did I come out of the womb to see labor and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?
verses.ct: Why did I ever come out of the womb? All I've seen is hardship and sorrow, and my days are wasting away in shame.
